Package dt.collectoClient

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • dt.collectoClient.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkEntity, ClientProtocol
    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientProtocol, NetworkEntity
    This class handles the interaction with the ClientBoard, the ClientView and the SocketHandler. It is an endpoint for the messages from the server. The view is also started from this class. This class is passive; it waits for input from either the SocketHandler or the ClientView
    Author:
    Emiel Rous and Wouter Koning

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the view in a new Thread. The actions initiated from the main thread stop here. The rest is handeld by the SocketHandler and the ClientView Thread.
        requires
        ClientView should be initiated
        ensures
        ClientView is started in a separate thread

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
        This is the main endpoint for the SocketHandler. Any message from the server passes through this method. From here methods from the ClientView and the ClientBoard are called
        Specified by:
        handleMessage in interface NetworkEntity
        Parameters:
        msg - the raw message from the server
        requires
        message should not be null
        ensures
        The state is changed for the following ServerMessages,ServerMessages.HELLO,ServerMessages.LOGIN,ServerMessages.NEWGAME,ServerMessages.MOVE,ServerMessages.GAMEOVER

      • doHello

        public void doHello()
        Sends a hello to the server.
        Specified by:
        doHello in interface ClientProtocol
        requires
        the state to be ClientStates.STARTINGUP
        ensures
        the state to become ClientStates.PENDINGHELLO

      • handleRanking

        public void handleRanking​(java.lang.String[] arguments)
                   throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Handle the response of the ranking. Parses the ranking to a string and passes it to the ClientView
        Parameters:
        arguments - split message from the server
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when the arguments length is 0, which is an invalid response from the server
        requires
        the arguments to be the raw split response from the server

      • doAIMove

        public void doAIMove()

                     java.net.ProtocolException
        Finds a move and plays it on the board
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException
        java.net.ProtocolException
        requires
        ai should not be null

      • doMove

        public void doMove​(Move move)
            throws InvalidMoveException,
                   java.net.ProtocolException
        Send a Move to the server. Wait for a response, then place it on the board
        Specified by:
        doMove in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        move -
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException
        java.net.ProtocolException
        requires
        Move to be valid, the server to respond with a move at some point
        ensures
        the state to stay the same if the move is invalid, the state to be changed to ClientStates.WAITTHEIRMOVE if the move is confirmed, the state to be changed to ClientStates.WAITOURMOVE if the move could not be confirmed, the to be played on the board if it is valid and it's verified and myTurn to be true, myTurn to be true if the move could not be confirmed

      • makeTheirMove

        public void makeTheirMove​(Move move)
                   throws InvalidMoveException
        Make the Move that the opponnent reponsds with
        Parameters:
        move -
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException
        requires
        Move their move to be valid
        ensures
        the state to be changed to ClientStates.WAITOURMOVE, myTurn to be true
